subject: RE: [junit] fundamental questions on JUnit
msgSnippet: ... What s wrong with forcing production code to change only to make it more testable? I came into the JUnit-ish lifestyle with this belief, but I don t hold
messageBody:
> (It is 'against the rules' to change the design of them to return
> values - a testing tool should not force code changes.)

What's wrong with forcing production code to change only to make it more
testable? I came into the JUnit-ish lifestyle with this belief, but I don't
hold to it anymore. Testability is a good quality to have -- and many times
it accidently improves the design.

Chris
